data: Refer to STOP-Bang Questionnaire: Screening Tool for OSA and Prediction of Baseline and Postoperative Risk from OSA Scoring System
Consider Baseline Risk and Postoperative Risk Indicators for determination of monitoring and disposition
Patient must stay for at least 1 hour after last respiratory event (unless being transferred to a monitored bed)
Patient must stay for at least 1 hour after standard PACU discharge criteria met
Extended PACU stay may be waived if Baseline Risk is Low / Not Increased
Order extended stay for spinal anesthesia if pain management challenge is expected, unless transferred to a monitored bed
Patient must stay until spinal anesthesia regressed below surgical incision
Final decision regarding appropriate postoperative disposition made by Anesthesiologist
Require monitored bed: Continuous pulse oximetry and possibility of early nursing intervention

Baseline Risk:  - Baseline Risk is LOW (2-3) ' discharge home or to standard ward if all above criteria met (no post-op risk indicators)  - Baseline Risk is MODERATE/INCREASED (4) ' ward or PACU/HAU upon assessment by perioperative or attending anesthesiologist  - Baseline Risk is HIGH/SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASED (5-6) ' monitored bed required
Patient may use Home Settings, apply if sedation scale greater than 1 or sleeping
Unless contraindicated by surgeon, place patient in semi-fowler or lateral position
